reviews.review: Haven't finished it yet but it feels like another Half Life, it's way longer than Blue Shift
It's basically Half-Life with new mechanics that all stand out and make this expansion more fun. Infinitely better than Blue Shift.
TOOOOP

Half Life: Opposing Force bize hikaye konusunda bir değişiklik yapmasada Black Mesa faciasını bize farklı bir karakterin gözünden anlatıyor. Hikayemiz HECU isimli özel bir askeri birliğinin Black Mesa faciasının tanıklarını yok etmek amacıyla gönderilen ekibi konu alıyor. Karakterimiz [b] Adrian Shephard'ın [/b] görevi ise [b] Freeman'ı bulup etkisiz hale getirmek [/b].
Bazı bölümlerde Freeman'ı görebiliyoruz fakat zarar veremiyor kendisine. 

Oynanışa gelirsek normal oyunun aksine daha farklı silahlar var. Silahlar dışında Xen gezegeninden gelen silahlı uzaylılar ile de savaşıyoruz. Geri kalanı zaten normal fps deneyimi. 

Umarım Valve Shephard'ı unutmamıştır da devam oyunlarında kullanır.

[h1]Half Life: Opposing Force Benden  9.5 aldı[/h1]
Najlepszy dodatek do HL1 o wiele lepszy niż Blue Shift
ce jeu est tres bugue et moche je pense quil devrait etre gratuit car paye pour ce truc bah ca ne vaut pas la peine

[h1]Период полураспада радиоактивных веществ : противодействующие силы[/h1]

Аддон к оригинальному Half-Life,  выпущенный сторонней студией Gearbox Software. В него стоит сыграть не только чтобы увидеть инцидент в чёрной мезе с другого ракурса, но и испытать  новшества, которыми не обделена эта часть, в отличии от Blue Shift.

[h1]Сюжет:[/h1]

Начинается примерно во время главы "поверхностное натяжение". Морпех Адриан Шепард вместе с товарищами был отправлен в чёрную мезу дабы истребить всё и вся, но не тут то было... В результате атаки электрических скатов выживает только Шепард, морпеху предстоит проделать нелёгкий путь через ксеновскую живность, тёмных оперативников и новых врагов - расу X.

Локации в основном отличаются от оригинала. Можно будет побывать в ядре лямбды, исследовательском центре из главы "сомнительная этика" и даже в тренировочном центре, который был только в Source, ну и конечно же, в ксене.

Но таинственный G-man не обошёл Шепарда стороной, и тоже местами то тут, то там появляется.

Однако многими игроками данная часть не считается каноном, из-за расы Х и морпехов, не убивавших учёных

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1777657220 

[h1]Геймплей:[/h1]

Помимо нового пушечного мяса, расы Х(пещерные трутни, шоковые солдаты и тд.), оперативники представлены ещё и мужчинами, в отличии от оригинала, здесь они основные враги, которые чем-то опаснее, чем те же морпехи в оригинале.

На протяжении игры перестрелок стало значительно больше, нежели головоломок, хотя и тут найдётся над чем поломать голову. Некоторые места зделаны весьма хардкорно, вроде тоннелей полных Валтигоров (здоровых и выносливых существ расы Х, способных буквально ваншотнуть персонажа) или места, где нужно закрыть шлюзы, через которые прут бесконечным потоком пещерные трутни.

С новыми врагами появились и новые союзники, здесь и обычные солдаты с mp5, с M249, полевые медики и инженеры, выпиливающие дверь. Но в целом такие союзники куда полезнее, чем охранники со слабыми glock-ами.

Арсенал оружия тоже обзавёлся новыми стволами : [i]Снайперская винтовка[/i], [i]Desert Eagle[/i] с лазерным прицелом, [i]пулемёт М249[/i], [i]шоковый таракан[/i](аналог рукоулья), [i]споровый метатель[/i](по урону что-то среднее между снайперкой и РПГ), [i]ручной барнакл[/i](прицепляется к определённым местам) и даже [i][strike]BFG[/strike][/i] [i]Телепортирующее орудие[/i], позволяющее при 60 единицах плазмы перемещатся в ксен. Итого имеем аж 7 типов оружия!

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1801246092 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1837514839

Но как и в оригинале, Opposing Force имеет боссов : пещерного червя, которого нужно победить, повернув вентиль Valve, активировав Steam и включив коробку передач Gearbox. Второй же, геночервь и тут тоже ест пасхалка, его "голос" это замедленное обратное воспроизведение фразы  «чтобы выиграть игру, ты должен убить меня, Рэнди Питчфорда».

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Opposing Force - пример эталонного дополнения, предлагающего не только новый взгляд на ту же историю, но и новых врагов, локации, оружие, союзников, и другое впечатление от прохождения.

Рекомендуется всем, такая же бессмертная классика, как и оригинальный Half - Life

[h1]9 мёртвых оперативников из 10[/h1]

This was sitting in my Steam Library for a long time.  I always thought it was a multiplayer game. Nope!  It is a single player campaign set in the half-life universe, and it's actually really good. I honestly can't remember how much I paid for it, but if you enjoyed the original half-life, you will probably enjoy this one too.
Half Life 1 de black mesa ya farklı bir gözle baktığımız oyun

A very interesting expansion by Gearbox.  You play as Shepherd, one of the soldiers constantly harrassi-I mean trying to take down Freeman in the original Half-Life.  Thing is, now you've got aliens AND some operatives trying to kill YOU and your comrades.  Tables have turned.

It's good, it's more difficult than the original game in my opinion.  It's much longer than Blue Shift.  I don't think you can not get this expansion anymore when you buy Half-Life so I just say get it and have some more fun.

Opposing Force is easily the longest (and in my opinion, the best) Half-Life expansion, despite some minor flaws. It has a large amount of long, enjoyable chapters which tell a cohesive story, has a refreshing variety of weaponry, interesting boss fights,[spoiler]especially the Pit Worm, which I found to be quite fun[/spoiler] and fair locations - for the MOST part, anyways. [spoiler]Looking at you, sewer section of Foxtrot Uniform, with that literal nest of ammo-sponge Voltigores and other "fun" creatures..[/spoiler]
excellent rien d'autre a dire (ou est half life decay par contre ): je le veux )

Я прошел эту игру с удовольствием. Тут больше потных боев (играл на сложном), чем в оригинале как мне показалось. Больше оружия и врагов, и это очень увлекательно. Это шикарное даже образцовое дополнение. Из оружия понравилось что у солдата есть нож, но вот зачем ему разводной ключ загадка. Моё любимое оружие это ручной гранатомет инопланетян и его альтернативная стрельба в частности. Второе оружие любимое это пулемет, очень убойное и эффективное оружие. 
Тут есть все достоинства оригинальной игры и даже больше, но унаследовала и минусы в виде спуска по лестницам, и прыжки на дистанцию. Я советую игру любителям шутеров и тем кому оигинальная игра понравилась.

Если вам понравился оригинальный Халф-Лайф, то эта часть обязательна к прохождению наряду с оригиналом. Больше арсенал, больше врагов, больше удовольствия. Стрелять придется много, но зато противниками будут новые пришельцы другого повелителя и Черные Оперативники (Black Ops), которые мельком встретились в оригинале. Даже захотелось, чтобы после Зена, разрабы Черной Мезы занялись этим эпизодом.

This is a very good add on to a classic title. This expansion pack brought several new weapons, enemies and a lot of different levels that involved new techniques such as grappling. It was interesting to see the world from another perspective and it was definitely fun to play through this expansion.

Without a doubt, the best damn expansion a game could have, as part of the U.S.M.C's fictional special forces branch the Hazardous. Enviroments. Combat Unit (HECU) Corporal Adrian Shephard, you and you alone are your own man, in the beginning your osprey (prominently associated with the HECU in the original half life game) is shot down way before your receive your orders leaving you to decide whether to kill or spare the black mesa scientist and security or kill them. Its a game that at least to me has always seemed to have the potential to rival half life in what it does, it is just magnificent, every gun serves a purpose, there are moments a good bit into the game and even further than that, where your come across and either work together, or avenge your fallen comarades in black mesa, whats especially unique is thoes Black ops that just felt somewhat like they were thrown in at random in the 1st game now have a real purpose in this, FINNISH WHAT THE HECU COULD NOT, wipe out the witnesses, marines included, and instead of retaking, just nuking black mesa, and the xen creatures have a fairly dominant role early on, and presumably while both because of gordan freeman defeating nihilanth in the og game and just the mad chaotic battle that raged in black mesa, the original aliens are both phased out, and well kept in, the next stage in the zombies were quite a suprise, and of course, RACE X. Another alien world seeing the beneifits earth could give, race X seeks to capitalize on the resonance cascade, along with the destructive conflict in black mesa, and take over earth, opposing force turns black mesa from having 3 factions fighting for control of the base (the original staff in black mesa, xen, and the marines) and makes it into 5 factions having open warfare (except for the ever dwindling remenants of the hecu and black mesa staff) for control and as the marines start going screw orders and working with the black mesa staff, the Black ops, xen, and most of all, RACE X, attract the LEAD bullets, and FULL METAL JACKETS, of Corporal Shepherd and the rest of the Hecu. there are moments towards the somewhat middle and later areas of opposing force where u meet up with the left behind forces of the hecu (shepherd included) and try to evacuate the facility going way beyond FUBAR, these are my favorite parts, along with the radio transmissions, i always felt tons of dissappointment and feeling of leaving them, feeling like more could be done, make it like these npcs follow your and deploy with your but if they die they can not ever be regained if your move foward with out them, also new marine models so that you dont shoot them, my favorite part was in the package when you get out of this sewer system and meet up with a couple of marines who along with your decide to FIGHT YOUR WAY OUT against the Black ops, with Bust playing in the backround you know its going to be a fight, as for feelings that spark dread, nothing spells that out better than the radio transmission your here before meeting the pit worm, a giant creature that is essentially this games blast pit, and is glaringly obvious, and with remains of your buddies nearby, your rage of how the died brings you to a new resolve, KILL THIS DAMN THING IN THE MOST BRUTAL WAY AND MAKE THEIR LIVES MEAN SOMETHING, now i have said alot about this game and my feeling that its only 5$ offends me because this game should be at least 6 or 7$, overall besides from some minor discrepancies, 10/10 Semper Fi marines Semper Fi
Лучшее дополнение из 2 оставшихся

Arguably vastly superior to the original in all aspects, bar length, Back in the bronze age, this was known as a challenging game. In >current year, I'd not be surprised if the average gamer finds it very difficult. Unlike HL, this game focuses on combat (you're a HECU marine sent in to 'silence' the facility and all associated assets) and, though primitive, things like taking cover behind terrain, baiting enemies with grenades, scoring fat gibs with the handful of satchels the game gives you, and using your advanced AI (for the late 90s) squad members properly is satisfying, and a reward all of its own, not to mention the huge selection of new weapons that augment the arsenal.

The theme of the game, for those who are interested in such things, is 'survival at all costs.'

The game's fairly stingy with supplies, but early into the game, you're given a special weapon that's all-but useless for offensive purposes, but teleports you to hazardous breather locations, as it were, where supplies, healing ponds, and so on, may be found - however, ammunition for this weapon is extremely limited, so you'll at most be using it once per level.

I played this when it came out, almost 20 years ago, and it still holds up today - though you'll want to set a more modern resolution, and tune the uber dark environments to accommodate 20 years of monitor technology and progress. About 8000k to 9300k monitor temperature  should do the trick, then adjust the actual contrast, and you'll be fragging like it's the 90s.

Highly recommended. One of my favorite oldschool shooters. It was then, it is now, and likely forever will be. If you're skimping out on this one, you're doing yourself a great disservice.

A good expansion for Half-Life. In this expansion, you play as Adrian Shephard, a member of the HECU sent to hunt down Gordon Freeman. So if you wanted to see Half-Life from the view of the bad guys then this is for you. And there's an entirely new threat on the rise as well, Xen is no longer the only alien civilization attacking Black Mesa, you now have to face an entirely new and mysterious alien race simply known as Race X and their army. I highly recommend this and Blue Shift to anyone who already owns and has beat the first Half-Life

Хорошее дополнение, с минимальным количеством недостатков. Новые уровни, прикольные пушки, забавные диалоги с оттенком армейского яйцекрутства и небольшая продолжительность, как раз, чтобы не надоесть. Худшее, что есть в игре - это выжигающий глаза фильтр ночного видения, я каждый раз блевал отслоившейся сетчаткой, когда его включал. В игре есть целая локация, с самыми душными противниками в игре, однообразными лабиринтами, и полным отсутствием света, должен сказать, что мне сей кислотный аттракцион душноты не принёс никакого удовольствия. Но потом игра опять раскачивается, и дальше всё идёт как по маслу. В одном из уровней можно заценить задницу Фримана. Вобщем, надеюсь, Шепарда когда-нибудь вытащат из стазиса, он мне даже ближе к сердцу пришёлся, чем повелитель монтировки.

[h1][b] Half-Life: Opposing Force [/b][/h1]
[quote=Half-Life] Ah shit, here we go again [/quote]

[b][u] Introduction [/u][/b]
On the job of finishing the whole Half-Life I stumbled upon the fact there are two expansions on Steam. Opposing Force is one of these. It introduces the greatest character in all of Half-Life... Adrian Shephard. The Opposing Force also adds changes a few things. As you may imagine at the end of the game you have different weapons than you'd have if you played OG Half-Life. It creates new interesting opportunities to make this experience unique and not only a repetition of the same as in one other expansion.
The marks I give in this review are mine and mine alone. I will be granting points, from 1 to 10, according to my choice and I will try to add comments whenever neccessary.

[table]
[tr]
[th]Criterion[/th]
[th]Mark[/th]
[th]Comments[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Story[/th]
[th]8/10[/th]
[th]The same events as in Half-Life although seen from another perspective[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Audio[/th]
[th]8.5/10[/th]
[th]It goes well with what's going on-screen[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Visual representation[/th]
[th]5/10[/th]
[th]In 2019 it shows the age[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Gameplay[/th]
[th]10/10[/th]
[th]First person shooting in its prime, puzzles not too hard[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Controls[/th]
[th]9/10[/th]
[th]Would be 10/10 if not for the crouch jump, Ctrl+Space is not intuitive, changing crouching key to key of choice makes it more bearable[/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

[b][u] Important notes [/u][/b]
If you finished this expansion and want more I recommend playing through another official expansion for Half-Life that was not released on PC. It is named [i] Decay [/i]. Thanks to the gracious Half-Life modding community all PC users can experience this expansion in full glory. To download the modification click >>[url=https://www.moddb.com/mods/half-life-decay/downloads/half-life-decay] HERE [/url]<<

[b][u] Conclusion [/u][/b]
Looking back at this experience I think I enjoyed this expansion a little more than the original Half-Life. I have finished it in 6 hours, but I am really bad at these kind of games. You can finish this expansion in half the time I spent on it. It is easily one of the best experiences I had ever pleasure of playing.

Opposing Force is a challenging, but fun game. Firefights are usually quick, but very dangerous. You will fight various enemies, including aliens and assassins. You can also find various weapons that can not only be powerful, but also exotic. One example includes a literal teleportation gun that will banish enemies to the shadow realm. If you want a challenge and/or interesting weapons, this is the game for you.

In Opposing Force, you are a faceless U.S. Marine by the name of Adrian Shephard with a job to do. Suddenly, you are put into advanced training for dealing with top secret research facilities because of that pesky G-man and his employers, and are sent to Black Mesa after it all goes downhill.
You never received your orders..so you end up trying to make sense of all of the chaos while your fellow Marines perish as the chaos unfolds.
Scientists and security are reluctant to help, and you do run into sparse Marine specialists to help you along the way to Lambda Complex, where you are trying to prevent a serious alien invasion from destroying the area. 
Eventually you win, and Adrian is put into a place by the G-man to be retained for 'potential future employment'

This expansion wanted to shed light on the Resonance Cascade through the eyes of the Black Mesa 'clean up crew', and see how it was on the other side of the fight. There are new mechanics, such as the ability to control specialized Marines that can open doors and heal you. There is also (awful) rope physics! Multiplayer was introduced in this expansion, but I have never played it so I can't speak for it.
The graphics, sound, AI, voice acting, controls, and general design of the game are exactly the same as the original Half-Life.

Play this if you want to see a side story set during the Resonance Cascade. And don't skip the boot camp! (training room)

- Story runs parallel to Gordon's journey through Black Mesa in HL1

Negatives:
- Terrible final boss
- More bullet sponge enemies
- Impractical new weapons and gear
- Support units' AI is terrible

Отличное дополнение к первой халфе, где главным героем выступает вояка, которого вместе с корешами отправили в чёрную мезу дабы зачистить её от свидетелей... и всякой неведанной живности естественно) Но что-то пошло не так и вертолёт на котором мы летели с корешами сбил скат-летун (я хз как назвать эту тварь). Мы естественно выжили... иии дальше я говорить не буду, увидите (если ещё не играли).
В общем отличное дополнение, проходится конечно быстро... нооо... есть онлайн, раз в кс 1.6 ещё кто-то играет, то и онлайн в этой игре мб зайдёт кому-нибудь.
10 из 10

No one is reading this part, are they?
Oh well.
Before playing this, play the original Half-Life. This is just an expansion pack to it.
It adds a lot of new weapons, new enemies, and a new singleplayer campaign.
I found the level design to be generally confusing, even more so than the original.
New weapons are nice! But the night vision goggles are more difficult to see with than the flashlight.
New enemies are nice! But it's not clearly stated why Dr. Freeman never encounters them.
The rope climbing mechanic is just plain confusing.
And that's my review! Thanks for actually reading the entire thing.

alright bai

If you liked the OG Half-Life, you'll like this one. Personally, I didn't like the OG Half-Life TOO much, from the BS cheap enemy spawns and the overreliance on bad first person platforming that makes the player save scum whether they want to or not. Is all that still in this expansion campaign? Yes, but lessened, and the campaign is shorter so it doesn't overstay its welcome.

I also found the weapon selection, while only SLIGHTLY varied from the first one, is an improvement. The special ops handgun that replaces the magnum in the original is great, the .50 cal (I think it's an FAL, not sure though) rules, and the alien guns, I thought, were way more useful. 

There's also more of a focus in this game on using survivors that you find and keeping them alive to help you out and use them in contextual situations than the first one, and I think that works well here. 

The only down side was that there were some tech problems getting this one up and running, as it wouldn't open properly and Steam seemed to think that the game was running when it was not. So I had to restart my computer, open the game, close hl.exe in my task manager, have Steam verify the files, THEN open the game again and it would work. Luckily, I was able to beat the game in 3 separate sessions, so I could uninstall this one quick, haha. Yeah, maybe it was just a computer problem locally, but I haven't had that problem with any other game on my Steam library, except for a slightly similar problem with Hitman Blood Money. Strange, be on the lookout for problems with this one. Some troubleshooting may be required.

The plot is also pretty cool, as they did a good job having it overlap with the original game, where the first 2/3rds of this game take place over the second half of the original, but from a separate perspective, humanizing the military a little more where in the OG they were just 100% evil and unsympathetic. You also get to see that Freeman wasn't the ONLY person the G-Man was utilizing to fulfill his ends.

All in all, where the OG Half-Life left a bit of a bitter taste in my mouth over the more aggravating aspects and flaws of the game that really built up near the end half, I didn't have as much of a problem with this one, as they had figured it out a little bit more and were just throwing together a short side campaign, and I thought it worked.

If you just care about the plot of Half-Life and the origins of Freeman, you're better off just playing the first one and then moving on to the second one, but if you just want to see what the gameplay of the original is like but want less frustrations, or if you REALLY liked the OG and want more of it, then try this one. It's less than $1 on sale, and if you bought the original Half-Life in a cheap pack on sale, then you already own this one.
